thread.title: Local sports digest: No. 6 Stanford beats Oregon State in women's soccer
thread.title_full: Local sports digest: No. 6 Stanford beats Oregon State in women's soccer

author: Bay Area News Group
title: Local sports digest: No. 6 Stanford beats Oregon State in women's soccer
text:
Local sports digest: No. 6 Stanford beats Oregon State in women's soccer Bay Area News Group Posted: 10/08/2015 09:54:39 PM PDT Updated: 10/08/2015 11:34:56 PM PDT Michelle Xiao scored less than two minutes into the match Thursday night, and the No. 6 Stanford women's soccer team went on to a 3-0 win over visiting Oregon State. 
Kyra Carusa's goal in the 35th minute gave the Cardinal (10-2, 4-0 Pac-12) a 2-0 halftime lead, and Stephanie Amack scored the game's final goal in the 85th minute. 
Zoe Makrigiannis made four saves and Dorthe Hoppius scored her fourth goal of the season as San Jose State (6-5-2, 4-1-0 Mountain West) beat Air Force 1-0 in Colorado Springs, Colorado. 
Cal freshman goalkeeper Jonathan Klinsmann had a tough day in the goal as the U.S. under-20 men's national team was thrashed by host Germany 8-1 this week at the Four Nations tournament. The Americans play Scotland on Friday and Mexico on Monday. Tennis Stanford's Tom Fawcett defeated Piotr Lomacki of Miami 6-4, 6-4 in the opening round of main draw singles competition at the Saint Francis ITA All-American Championships in Tulsa, Oklahoma. Cal's Andre Goransson and Florian Lakat also won their matches. Goransson outlasted South Florida's Sasha Gozun 6-4, 3-6, 7-5, and Lakat edged TCU's Trevor Johnson, 7-5, 6-7 (4), 7-6 (5). 
Fawcett is also competing in doubles, teaming with Maciek Romanowicz for a first-round win over Louisville's Jeffrey Brown and Alex Gornet. Cal's Goransson and Lakat lost their doubles match to San Diego's Jordan Angus and Flilp Vittek. Advertisement 
Stanford's Caroline Doyle and Taylor Davidson scored first-round singles wins in the main draw of the Riviera/ITA All-American Championships in Pacific Palisades. 
Doyle defeated Tina Bokhua of Colorado 6-1, 6-2, and Davidson beat Viktoria Lushkova of Oklahoma State 6-4, 6-0. 
Cal's Maegan Manasse and Klara Fabikova also won their singles matches. Manasse, the No. 3 seed, beat Saska Gavrilovska of Texas A&M 6-4, 6-7 (5), 6-1. Fabikova defeated UCLA's Catherine Harrison 7-6 (2), 2-6, 6-3. 
In doubles play, Cal's Manasse and Denise Starr won their match. Stanford's Doyle and Caroline Lampl were defeated. Volleyball Boise State swept visiting San Jose State 25-22, 25-16, 25-12. Hana Tresnakova had 12 kills and Allison Meehan 25 assists for the Spartans (10-8, 2-3 Mountain West). 
San Diego defeated Saint Mary's 25-21, 25-15, 19-25, 25-13 in Moraga. Alexis Salmons had 10 kills for the Gaels (6-10, 1-5 West Coast Conference). Arena football The SaberCats have exercised options on eight rookies from last season and added three players to their roster. The defending ArenaBowl champions have been assigned center Matt Armstrong, defensive back Lavelle Westbrooks and wide receiver Cordell Roberson. 
San Jose also will bring back wide receivers Diondre Borel, Mike Willie and Brandon Collins; defensive linemen Chris McAllister, Damien Borel and Gustave Benthin; defensive back Fredrick Obi; and offensive lineman Viondy Merisma.
